verses.text: The Lord hath made known his salvation, his righteousness hath he openly shewn in the sight of the heathen.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 19:15
verses.text: And the whole multitude of saints answered, saying, This honour have all his saints, Amen, Praise ye the Lord.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 19:16
verses.text: Afterwards, the prophet Habbakuk cried out, and said, Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, even for salvation with thine anointed.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 19:17
verses.text: And all the saints said, Blessed is he who cometh in the name of the Lord; for the Lord hath enlightened us. This is our God for ever and ever; he shall reign over us to everlasting ages. Amen.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 19:18
verses.text: In like manner all the prophets spake the sacred things of his praise, and followed the Lord.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:1
verses.text: Then the Lord, holding Adam by the hand, delivered him to Michael the archangel; and he led them into Paradise, filled with mercy and glory;

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:2
verses.text: And two very ancient men met them, and were asked by the saints, Who are ye, who have not yet been with us in hell, and have had your bodies placed in Paradise?

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:3
verses.text: One of them answering, said, I am Enoch, who was translated by the word of God: and this man who is with me, is Elijah the Tishbite, who was translated in a fiery chariot.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:4
verses.text: Here we have hitherto been, and have not tasted death, but are now about to return at the coming of Antichrist, being armed with divine signs and miracles, to engage with him in battle, and to be slain by him at Jerusalem, and to be taken up alive again into the clouds, after three days and a half.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:5
verses.text: And while the holy Enoch and Elias were relating this, behold there came another man in a miserable figure, carrying the sign of the cross upon his shoulders.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:6
verses.text: And when all the saints saw him, they said to him, Who art thou? For thy countenance is like a thief's; and why dost thou carry a cross upon thy shoulders?

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:7
verses.text: To which he answering, said, Ye say right, for I was a thief, who committed all sorts of wickedness upon earth.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:8
verses.text: And the Jews crucified me with Jesus; and I observed the surprising things which happened in the creation at the crucifixion of the Lord Jesus.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:9
verses.text: And I believed him to be the Creator of all things, and the Almighty King; and I prayed to him, saying. Lord remember me, when thou contest into thy kingdom.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:10
verses.text: He presently regarded my supplication, and said to me, Verily I say unto thee, this day thou shalt be with me in Paradise.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:11
verses.text: And he gave me this sign of the cross, saying, Carry this, and go to Paradise; and if the angel who is the guard of Paradise will not admit thee, show him the sign of the cross, and say unto him Jesus Christ who is now crucified, hath sent me hither to thee.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:12
verses.text: When I did this and told the angel who is the guard of Paradise all these things, and he heard them, he presently opened the gates, introduced me, and placed me on the right hand in Paradise,

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:13
verses.text: Saying, Stay here a little time, till Adam, the father of all mankind, shall enter in, with all his sons, who are the holy and righteous servants of Jesus Christ, who was crucified.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 20:14
verses.text: When they heard all this account from the thief, all the patriarchs said with one voice, Blessed be thou, O Almighty God, the Father of everlasting goodness, and the Father of mercies, who hast shown such favour to those who were sinners against him, and hast brought them to the mercy of Paradise, and hast placed them amidst thy large and spiritual provisions, in a spiritual and holy life. Amen.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:1
verses.text: These are the divine and sacred mysteries which we saw and heard. We, Charinus and Lenthius are not allowed to declare the other mysteries of God, as the archangel Michael ordered us,

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:2
verses.text: Saying, ye shall go with my brethren to Jerusalem, and shall continue in prayers, declaring and glorifying the resurrection of Jesus Christ, seeing he hath raised you from the dead at the same time with himself.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:3
verses.text: And ye shall not talk with any man, but sit as dumb persons till the time come when the Lord will allow you to relate the mysteries of his divinity.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:4
verses.text: The archangel Michael farther commanded us to go beyond Jordan, to an excellent and fat country, where there are many who rose from the dead along with us for the proof of the resurrection of Christ.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:5
verses.text: For we have only three days allowed us from the dead, who arose to celebrate the passover of our Lord with our parents, and to bear our testimony for Christ the Lord, and we have been baptized in the holy river of Jordan. And now they are not seen by any one.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:6
verses.text: This is as much as God allowed us to relate to you; give ye therefore praise and honour to him, and repent, and he will have mercy upon you. Peace be to you from the Lord God Jesus Christ, and the Saviour of us all. Amen, Amen, Amen.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:7
verses.text: And after they had made an end of writing, and had written on two distinct pieces of paper, Charinus gave what he wrote into the hands of Annas, and Caiaphas, and Gamaliel.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:8
verses.text: Lenthius likewise gave what be wrote into the hands of Nicodemus and Joseph; and immediately they were changed into exceeding white forms and were seen no more.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:9
verses.text: But what they had written was found perfectly to agree, the one not containing one letter more or less than the other.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:10
verses.text: When all the assembly of the Jews heard all these surprising relations of Charinus and Lenthius, they said to each other, Truly all these things were wrought by God, and blessed be the Lord Jesus for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:11
verses.text: And they went all out with great concern, and fear, and trembling, and smote upon their breasts and went away every one to his home.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:12
verses.text: But immediately all these things which were related by the Jews in their synagogues concerning Jesus, were presently told by Joseph and Nicodemus to the governor.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 21:13
verses.text: And Pilate wrote down all these transactions, and placed all these accounts in the public records of his hall.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:1
verses.text: After these things Pilate went to the temple of the Jews, and called together all the rulers and scribes, and doctors of the law, and went with them into a chapel of the temple.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:2
verses.text: And commanding that all the gates should be shut, said to them, I have heard that ye have a certain large book in this temple; I desire you, therefore, that it may be brought before me.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:3
verses.text: And when the great book, carried by four ministers of the temple, and adorned with gold and precious stones, was brought, Pilate said to them all, I adjure you by the God of your Fathers, who made and commanded this temple to be built, that ye conceal not the truth from me.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:4
verses.text: Ye know all the things which are written in that book; tell me therefore now, if ye in the Scriptures have found any thing of that Jesus whom ye crucified, and at what time of the world he, ought to have come: show it me.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:5
verses.text: Then having sworn Annas and Caiaphas, they commanded all the rest who were with them to go out of the chapel.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:6
verses.text: And they shut the gates of the temple and of the chapel, and said to Pilate, Thou hast made us to swear, O judge, by the building of this temple, to declare to thee that which is true and right.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:7
verses.text: After we had crucified Jesus, not knowing that he was the Son of God, but supposing he wrought his miracles by some magical arts, we summoned a large assembly in this temple.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:8
verses.text: And when we were deliberating among one another about the miracles which Jesus had wrought, we found many witnesses of our own country, who declared that they had seen him alive after his death, and that they heard him discoursing with his disciples, and saw him ascending into the height of the heavens, and entering into them;

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:9
verses.text: And we saw two witnesses, whose bodies Jesus raised from the dead, who told us of many strange things which Jesus did among the dead, of which we have a written account in our hands.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:10
verses.text: And it is our custom annually to open this holy book before an assembly, and to search there for the counsel of God.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:11
verses.text: And we found in the first of the seventy books, where Michael the archangel is speaking to the third son of Adam the first man, an account that after five thousand five hundred years, Christ the most beloved son of God was to come on earth,

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:12
verses.text: And we further considered, that perhaps he was the very God of Israel who spoke to Moses, Thou shalt make the ark of the testimony; two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:13
verses.text: By these five cubits and a half for the building of the ark of the Old Testament, we perceived and knew that in five thousand years and half (one thousand) years, Jesus Christ was to come in the ark or tabernacle of a body;

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:14
verses.text: And so our Scriptures testify that he is the Son of God, and the Lord and King of Israel.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:15
verses.text: And because after his suffering, our chief priests were surprised at the signs which were wrought by his means, we opened that book to search all the generations down to the generation of Joseph and Mary the mother of Jesus, supposing him to be of the seed of David;

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:16
verses.text: And we found the account of the creation, and at what time he made the heaven and the earth, and the first man Adam, and that from thence to the flood, were two thousand seven hundred and forty- eight years.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:17
verses.text: And from the flood to Abraham, nine hundred and twelve. And from Abraham to Moses, four hundred and thirty. And from Moses to David the King, five hundred and ten.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:18
verses.text: And from David to the Babylonish captivity five hundred years. And from the Babylonish captivity to the incarnation of Christ, four hundred years.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:19
verses.text: The sum of all which amounts to five thousand and half (a thousand.)

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 22:20
verses.text: And so it appears, that Jesus whom we crucified, is Jesus Christ the Son of God, and true Almighty God. Amen.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 23:1
verses.text: In the name of the Holy Trinity, thus end the acts of our Saviour Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 23:2
verses.text: The Emperor Theodosius the Great found these acts at Jerusalem, in the hall of Pontius Pilate, among the public records.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 23:3
verses.text: These things were acted in the nineteenth year of Tiberius Caesar, Emperor of the Romans, and in the seventeenth year of the government of Herod, the son of Herod and of Galilee.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 23:4
verses.text: This occurred on the eighth of the calends of April, which is the twenty-third day of the month of March, in the CCIId Olympiad, when Joseph and Caiaphas were rulers of the Jews.

verses.name: Gospel of Nicodemus 23:5
verses.text: This is a History written in Hebrew by Nicodemus, of what happened after our Saviour's crucifixion.
